object.name: setMessageReaction
object.description: Use this method to change the chosen reactions on a message. Service messages of some types can't be reacted to. Automatically forwarded messages from a channel to its discussion group have the same available reactions as messages in the channel. Bots can't use paid reactions. Returns True on success.
object.html_description: Use this method to change the chosen reactions on a message. Service messages of some types can't be reacted to. Automatically forwarded messages from a channel to its discussion group have the same available reactions as messages in the channel. Bots can't use paid reactions. Returns True on success.
object.rst_description: Use this method to change the chosen reactions on a message. Service messages of some types can't be reacted to. Automatically forwarded messages from a channel to its discussion group have the same available reactions as messages in the channel. Bots can't use paid reactions. Returns :code:`True` on success.

annotations.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.html_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format :code:`@channelusername`)
annotations.name: chat_id

annotations.description: Identifier of the target message. If the message belongs to a media group, the reaction is set to the first non-deleted message in the group instead.
annotations.html_description: Identifier of the target message. If the message belongs to a media group, the reaction is set to the first non-deleted message in the group instead.
annotations.rst_description: Identifier of the target message. If the message belongs to a media group, the reaction is set to the first non-deleted message in the group instead.
annotations.name: message_id

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized list of reaction types to set on the message. Currently, as non-premium users, bots can set up to one reaction per message. A custom emoji reaction can be used if it is either already present on the message or explicitly allowed by chat administrators. Paid reactions can't be used by bots.
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized list of reaction types to set on the message. Currently, as non-premium users, bots can set up to one reaction per message. A custom emoji reaction can be used if it is either already present on the message or explicitly allowed by chat administrators. Paid reactions can't be used by bots.
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized list of reaction types to set on the message. Currently, as non-premium users, bots can set up to one reaction per message. A custom emoji reaction can be used if it is either already present on the message or explicitly allowed by chat administrators. Paid reactions can't be used by bots.
annotations.name: reaction

annotations.description: Pass True to set the reaction with a big animation
annotations.html_description: Pass True to set the reaction with a big animation
annotations.rst_description: Pass :code:`True` to set the reaction with a big animation
annotations.name: is_big
